title: Calories in a Jalapeño Pepper
meta_description: Discover calories in a jalapeno pepper, plus carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and other nutrients on a per-pepper basis with quick tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Fresh, raw jalapeño pepper, medium size (~14 g), green and unripe.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium raw jalapeño pepper has about 4 kcal and is low in fat and protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pickled in brine (adds sodium and slight calories)
Stuffed with cheese (1 oz cream cheese)

faqs.q: How many calories in a jalapeno pepper?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal for one medium raw jalapeño pepper.
Yes, one pepper has ~0.9 g carbs, including 0.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in a jalapeno pepper?
faqs.a: Minimal change if no oil added; roasting adds ~1 kcal.
Very low at ~1 mg per raw pepper; pickling increases it significantly.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in a jalapeno pepper?
faqs.a: Larger peppers (e.g., 20 g) may have 6 kcal; smaller ones fewer.
